Thank you for getting back to us.

As I mentioned in my previous response, when a user is part in multiple policies, the EPP is scanning the file transfer and applies the policy action. 

When you have 10 policies applied, 9 with policy action : Report Only and 1 with Block & Report, when EPP reach that policy ( Block&Report)  the file transfer will be blocked. 

As we demonstrated in the meeting after you removed the exit point the issue was fixed. 

Please let us know if there is anything else that we can assist you with, or we can close this case.

Firstly, apologies for the confusion. Since, we were testing multiple scenarios I forgot to mention the reason clearly when I asked to reopen the case.

If you remember, for the policy SM Instagram the exit points were only browsers and not the Outlook application (E-mail Client). Since the exit points are only browsers and it will block uploads in every website (browsers), this is understood that it is working the way it should be.

The concern is that we will create multiple policies depending on our business needs and this kind of bug existing somewhere else (other exit points) should not block us from applying new policies in the future.

Hence, please ensure the same is validated with the test build provided.

Thanks!



Best Regards,
